page.title: 02Braunton Great Field.
page.content: Braunton great fields are situated between Braunton and Saunton.The Great field is{only one of three}left in Britain.In{1905,}there used to be sixty farmers, but now{(1985)},there are only five.The Great fields take up about 350 acres to the south-west of the village.It is an archaeological site because,it has been farmed since mediaeval times when all the fields were in strips seperated by{balks {(banks of grass between strips).}Now, with modern machinery,the strips are too narrow,so the farmers are taking the balk away, and making larger fields.The great fields would be ruined,so archaeologists hope it will stay in it's present form,a mixture of strips and larger fields.
